Rep: Luis Gutierrez, D-Ill., stated on CNN’s State of the Union that immigrants with provisional legal status would not receive help paying their health insurance premiums under Obamacare and would not receive credit for any Social Security taxes they paid during their time working illegally.
Gutierrez: s staff clarified that he was referring to means-tested federal benefits, including Medicaid, Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF or welfare), and the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP or food stamps).
The Border Security: Economic Opportunity, and Immigration Modernization Act, which grants immigrants without documents permission to live and work legally in the country, includes a provision that states that RPI and blue card holders are not eligible for any federal means-tested public benefit. This provision refers to a law passed in 1996 that listed various benefits, including retirement, welfare, health, disability, public or assisted housing, postsecondary education, food assistance, unemployment benefit, or any similar benefit.
